author: Chicago Tribune staff
title: Man struck, killed in hitand-run crash near Buffalo Grove - Buffalo Grove Countryside
text:
A 68-year-old man was struck and killed during a hit-and-run accident late Monday evening near northwest suburban Buffalo Grove, authorities said.
Officials discovered James A. Spicak, of the 16000 block of West Pope Boulevard, lying unresponsive in a ditch around 11 p.m. near the intersection of Pope Boulevard and Eugene Avenue in unincorporated Prairie View, according to a release from the Lake County Sheriff’s Office.
According to preliminary investigation, an unknown vehicle was traveling westbound on West Pope Boulevard when it struck several mailboxes as well as Spicak, who was standing near his own mailbox. The driver of the vehicle fled the scene, authorities said.
An ambulance took Spicak to Advocate Condell Medical Center, where he was later pronounced dead, according to the release.
The crash remains under investigation. No one was in custody as a result of the incident early Tuesday.
Anyone with information about the incident should call the Lake County Sheriff’s Office at 847-548-5200 or Lake County Crime Stoppers at 847-662-2222.
